result.execSummary:
The defendant Harvey James Frank Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
6 days credit only if revoked (stipulated)
Concurrent with: Count 4

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter into any taverns/bars.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with current program that he has attended.

The defendant must attend at least one AA meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: As deemed appropriate by P&P and to be performed the first 6 months of probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Harvey James Frank in court. Called 3:04 PM. FTR recorded. Frank makes statement and asks for a $200/month payment plan. Court so orders $200/month, commencing 12/1/16.
Payment hearing on November 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Harvey James Frank in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:46 AM. State - resolved - moves to amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with $500.00 fine plus costs, DRI count #2, plead G/NC to counts #3 and #4 as alleged. State - on counts #3 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 12 months with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 60 hours of community service as deemed appropriate by P&P, $100 fine plus costs on each coount, maintain/obtain full time employment/school. Ferguson and Frank agree. Court amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, Frank pleads NC, finds G, forfeiture of $500.00 plus costs totalling $834.50 - 60 DTP/CO. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Frank pleasd NC to counts #3 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencng - follow joint recommendation. Ferguson makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Frank makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year on both counts, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: both counts #3 and #4 - AODA and/or follow thru with current program that he has attended, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 60 hours of community service as deemed appropriate by P&P and to be performed within the first 6 months of probation, attend at least one AA meeting per week, $100 fine plus costs on each count - paid witnin 60 days/CO, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, credit for 6 days only if revoked (stipulated), submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on June 27, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Harvey James Frank in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:15 AM. Ferguson and Frank have complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues bond, accepts pleas, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Harvey James Frank in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:09 AM. State - here for INIT. Frank does not have complaint. State will provide defendant with complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Frank understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford his own and has contacted Attorney Gary Cirilli who is unavailable for today. Court continues bond, sets for AIA. Frank asks for reduction in bond for stated reasons - on P&P hold, going to treatment on Monday. State - bond - $500.00 cash for stated reasons. Court - bond - $2000.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
